poem:
**Concrete Dreams**

Bricks whisper stories on gentrified streets,  
where windows blink into homes, unmade.  
Elevators rise through hopes misplaced,  
cubicles recall the laughter erased.  
In corridors, echoes of meetings fade—  
the city reshapes in sleepless plans.  
Yet paper walls can't house lost hands,  
who wander the margins, unseen, unclaimed.
